channel.title: I foresee a problem
channel.description: ...with this rampant proxy use. Everyone knows that IRC servers can and do detect users who log through a proxy with a simple connection attempt. How long until Jagex gets that clever little idea?

item.title: I foresee a problem
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

actually, sbot3 (used) to be pretty undetectable, i macroed on some account with it for months and its still not banned and yes, pplsuqbawlz did say he had some kind of uberbot, lol

Read full topic

item.title: I foresee a problem
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

It doesn't have anything to deal with Deobfuscating the code, so this removes the possibillities of a lot of traps.

I still have 400 pages of this E-book before I get into bytecode class loaders.

Read full topic

item.title: I foresee a problem
item.dc:creator: @kmb Kmb
item.description:
@kmb wrote:

RLN:

[quote author=Pwnd link=topic=287.msg20578#msg20578 date=1146293292]
Doesn't Java only have a limitted access to a person's computer?

Also, wouldn't Linux/Mac/ect. users need a different client then? I don't think that kind of portabillity would come with Java, or any other languages.

Java has access to process's through JNI(Java Native Interface) so it wouldn't be cross platform. As I said before that process scanner will never happen. There are plenty of ways they could eliminate autoers but I think the way they are doing it now is good enough(for now anyway), has anyone actually made an undetectable, "good" bot?[/quote]
Pplsuqbawlz says he has one.

Read full topic

item.title: I foresee a problem
item.dc:creator: @RLN RLN
item.description:
@RLN wrote:

Pwnd:

Doesn't Java only have a limitted access to a person's computer?

Also, wouldn't Linux/Mac/ect. users need a different client then? I don't think that kind of portabillity would come with Java, or any other languages.

Java has access to process's through JNI(Java Native Interface) so it wouldn't be cross platform. As I said before that process scanner will never happen. There are plenty of ways they could eliminate autoers but I think the way they are doing it now is good enough(for now anyway), has anyone actually made an undetectable, "good" bot?

Read full topic

item.title: I foresee a problem
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

There is no way a process scanner method would work, because it couldnt do anything if you ran the unsigned applet, and even if they removed that option there are things you can do to hide processes, or just stop that code from executing by overriding it

Read full topic

item.title: I foresee a problem
item.dc:creator: @newbiehacker newbiehacker
item.description:
@newbiehacker wrote:

they wouldn't be able to scan your computer for running processes if it was all done within the java client because it would just return java.exe

item.title: I foresee a problem
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

They can only detect that you have an open proxy port on your computer, there are some legitament players that would have this and be flagged as bad, anyway you look at it it is better than connecting with your real IP, If they do it we can cross that bridge when we come to it

Read full topic

item.title: I foresee a problem

item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Never. They won't do IP bans unless they can figure out a reliable way not to ban libraries, computers with multiple players, universities, etc...

Read full topic

item.title: I foresee a problem
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

Pwnd:

[quote author=Krichevskoy link=topic=287.msg3017#msg3017 date=1142128860]
...with this rampant proxy use. Everyone knows that IRC servers can and do detect users who log through a proxy with a simple connection attempt. How long until Jagex gets that clever little idea?

Well, seeing as they can fuck us over at anytime they wanted, I'll give them a year. There are so many things that Jagex can do to shut us down, but they don't.

One thing, they can ask to see all of the programs running at the time. Some would think this is illegal, but if you agree to it, it isn't [/quote]
I'd better start reading the terms of service..

Read full topic

item.title: I foresee a problem
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

Heh, Jagex could do alot, but they underestimate us, we might not (all) have had professional programming education and such, but that doesn't mean we're worthless, with our skills combinezd we could prolly screw them over a million times

Read full topic

item.title: I foresee a problem

Some

item.title: I foresee a problem
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

Pwnd:

Well, seeing as they can fuck us over at anytime they wanted, I'll give them a year. There are so many things that Jagex can do to shut us down, but they don't.

One thing, they can ask to see all of the programs running at the time. Some would think this is illegal, but if you agree to it, it isn't

What makes you so sure that they won't? They're willing to alienate a lot of fans with excessive and irritating random events, but they're not willing to implement a proxy check that would be invisible to legitimate users?

I wish them luck getting unsigned Java applets to do that program check

Read full topic
